meanings.definition: The ability of a material to store electrical energy in an electric field.
meanings.sent1: The permittivities of certain substances allow them to hold electric power.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the permittivities of different materials to understand their electrical properties.
meanings.sent3: The permittivities of rubber bands make them great for holding static electricity.
meanings.sent4: The permittivities of clouds seem to store the energy of lightning strikes.
meanings.sent5: The permittivities of batteries determine their capacity to retain charge.

meanings.definition: The ratio of the electric displacement to the electric field intensity in a dielectric material.
meanings.sent1: Understanding permittivities helps in calculating the efficiency of electrical devices.
meanings.sent2: Engineers often consider permittivities when designing capacitors for electronic circuits.
meanings.sent3: The permittivities of the new insulation material were off the charts!
meanings.sent4: The permittivities of the glass acted like a magnifying glass for the electric field.
meanings.sent5: The permittivities of the air changed dramatically during the storm, affecting radio signals.
